name: Tom Yum Noodle Soup Recipe (Guay Tiew Tom Yum)
description: Authentic tom yum noodle soup recipe, easy to make at home and perfect for meal prep.
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons chili paste oil (optional, see notes)
pork balls (see notes, optional, add to taste)
fried wonton wrappers (see notes, optional, add to taste)

itemListElement.text: In a medium-heated pot, bring water to a rolling boil. Add pork bones, light soy sauce, salt, onions, coriander root, garlic, and black peppercorns. Once boiling, skim off impurities for a clear broth. After skimming, reduce to low heat; simmer for 90 minutes. Then, reserve 27 fl oz of broth for assembling 4 servings of soup later.

itemListElement.text: Fill a pot halfway with water and boil on high heat. Boil and strain minced pork until fully cooked. Drain well.
itemListElement.name: Fill a pot halfway with water and boil on high heat. Boil and strain minced pork until fully cooked. Drain well.

itemListElement.text: In a large mixing bowl, mix cooked pork with the reserved broth. Add lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, chili flakes, peanuts, and optional chili paste oil. Stir thoroughly.

itemListElement.text: If you’re using egg noodles, pull them apart to prevent sticking. For dry noodles, first soak as per package instructions. Blanch bean sprouts and noodles until just tender.

itemListElement.text: Toss drained noodles and bean sprouts in garlic oil.

itemListElement.text: Evenly distribute noodles and bean sprouts into four serving bowls.

itemListElement.text: Ladle the soup (step 3) equally over the noodles in bowls.

itemListElement.text: Garnish with your chosen toppings: soft-boiled egg, fried wontons, coriander, pork balls, or liver. Serve hot and enjoy!
